root

Class GameServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • root.GameServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(name="game",
            urlPatterns="/game")
public class GameServer
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void acceptBattleRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response, Request r)
      acceptBattleRequest confirms the request sent from one user to another asking for battle and deletes it from the notification lists for both users.
      private void acceptFriendRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response, Request r)
      acceptFriendRequest First, the notification is deleted, then the id of both users are exchanged and put into their lists of 'friends', it the method fails, the exception is redirected to be handled by printStackTrace method
      private void acceptRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      acceptRequest marks the request as 'accepted'.
      private void addFriend(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      addFriend a method tries to find the matching string in database and if it is found, the match is sent a friend request if the friend is not found, an error message is returned when friend request is accepted/declined by the user, the method either creates the link between players or not.
      private void changeName(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      changeName updates the name field with a new value for the chosen monster_id
      private void declineRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      declineRequest allows the user to reject and 'drop/fail' the requests sent to him, and then deletes it from the notification list.
      protected void doGet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      doGet responsible for performing actions in response to requests
      protected void doPost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      doPost recives all the requests from the client side - the major function that everything is put through.
      private void getAllRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      getAllRequest prints all current notifications for the user that have not been accepted/rejected/viewed.
      private void getAllResults(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      getAllResults gets the user's username and id from the database; gets type of request; depending on request prints the various monster stats (battle monster stats for battles - baby stats for breeding), along with appropriate comments to the notification.
      private void getFriends(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      getFriends prints the list of user's friends with their username, id, server address.
      private void getFriendsMonsters(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      getFriendsMonsters prints friends' monsters in the following format: name, ID, is it available to buy or breed, buy cost, cost to breed, strength, health, fertility, defence, aggression, breed.
      private void getMonsters(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      getMonsters Outputs all monsters one at a time with all their stats in a set order: name, ID, is it available to buy or breed, buy cost, cost to breed, strength, health, fertility, defence, aggression, breed.
      private void getRichList(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      getRichList generates a list of all the users' friends (+user) and sorts them from lowest to highiest cash value.
      private void GetUserData(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      GetUserData requests the user's name and key id to then output the username and cash values
      private void IsLoggedIn(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      IsLoggedIn checks wether user is logged in and prints the output for later use
      private void LogIn(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      LogIn loads in the user into the server and validates all of it- loads in all of the monsters, friends, and friends' monsters on lists and all the notifications - plus redirecting it all around where needed.
      private void LogOut(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      LogOut removes the user from the current server session
      private void newBattleRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      newBattleRequest Sends out the request to marked user with a marked user's monster that is required for battle if failed or passed and appropriate response is printed out.
      private void newBreedRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      the request is sent out, the user who accepted is first looses cash, then babies are generated and added into his monster list Lastly, money is added to the user who set out his monster out for breeding - a notification is created and sent out to notifications.
      private void newBuyRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      newBuyRequest gets the id of the selling/buying users and the sold monster,set the buying user's cash to current ammount - price set the selling user's cash to current ammount + price; pass the result specific to each user (monster sold to selling user and bought monster to buying user).
      private void NewUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      NewUser creates a new user and a monster for them, inserting it into the database
      private void reloadfreinds(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      reloadFriends method allowing you to update the friend list it seems.
      private void reloadmonsters(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      reloadmonsters allows monsters to be updated during one session without shutting the server down and turning it on again.
      private void reloadnotifications(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      reloadnotifications same case like other reloads.
      private void setBreedCost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) 
      private void setBuyCost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)

      • LogIn

        private void LogIn(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        LogIn loads in the user into the server and validates all of it- loads in all of the monsters, friends, and friends' monsters on lists and all the notifications - plus redirecting it all around where needed. if the user has no monsters, a new one is generated for him, stored in a query and added to the database
        Parameters:
        request - the request from the client-side;
        response - the response from the server;
